protocol_name: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
protocol_name_html: Soil viral extraction protocol for ssDNA & dsDNA viruses
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"11en8","text":"Protocol for resuspending viruses from soils and sediments. See attached file for considerations, adaptations, and references. This version does not include CsCl purification, see version 2 for CsCl information. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c13g6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"64n17","text":"      Preparations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b65m7","text":"AKC Buffer (Make before and store at 4°C)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m2i5","text":"“Amended K-citrate”: 1% K-citrate + 10% PBS + 5 mM EDTA (don’t add if doing DNase) + 150 mM MgSO4; (per Liter: 10g of k-citrate, 1.44g of Na2HPO4 *7H2O, and 0.24g of KH2PO4 brought to pH 7)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":96,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":140,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":144,"length":2,"style":"sub"},{"offset":149,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":168,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":171,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j8of","text":"1% BSA (w/v) in PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6tbd","text":"Need 2 ml per Amicon filter. Prepare 1% BSA (w/v) in PBS.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2m1h","text":"DNase","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"884b6","text":"Weigh out sample in 50 ml centrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation:
• Trubl, G., Solonenko, N., Chittick, L., Solonenko, S.A., Rich, V.I. and Sullivan, M.B., 2016. Optimization of viral resuspension methods for carbon-rich soils along a permafrost thaw gradient. PeerJ, 4, p.e1999. 
  • Trubl, G., Solonenko, N., Li, YF, Roux, S., Bolduc, B.; Rodríguez-Ramos, J., Carlson, M., Eloe-Fadrosh, E., Rich, V.I., Sullivan, M.B. (Submitted to PeerJ). Shifting from particles to DNA: a protocol to generate viromes from challenging soils.

More protocols on www.protocols.io under Dr. Matthew Sullivan's lab
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"3jfmf","text":"Need to record how much buffer is collected for viral counts","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"291g1","text":"During the manual shaking, make sure the sample is broken up","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qs9g","text":"The more new tubes the samples touch, the greater the viral loss will be","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jt7h","text":"For the Amicon step, try not to use new filters. The filters will slowly get clogged and it may take a while depending on how many contaminants (e.g. organics) there are. Using new filters will increase viral loss. The same concept applies to the 0.2 µM filters. The composition of the filter may affect viral recovery.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5017","text":"For the DNA extraction, use the Qiagen PowerSoil DNA extraction kit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38mpg","text":"Need to do Swift library prep. If you want quantitative samples that have both ssDNA and dsDNA viruses","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jjnb","text":"I have outlined areas where you can stop (store in 4°C overnight)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t1d0","text":"This protocol does not include EDTA in the AKC buffer. EDTA interferes with DNase and it mainly used to chelate metals. Don’t add unless you have high metal contamination","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qih7","text":"You will get contamination from any past or present viruses cultured or used in the lab","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

{"blocks":[{"key":"e80m5","text":"Filter supernatant with a 0.22 or 0.45 \u00b5m vacuum filter into new 50 ml tubes to remove microbes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vjo5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bi7c9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

0.22 \u00b5m may lose larger viruses, but increase microbial contamination<\/p>"},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

use fewer filters to loose fewer viruses; filter type affects viral recovery<\/p>"}]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bn67q","text":"Store the filtrate at 4\u00b0C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cee8t","text":"Incubate 2 ml of 1% BSA on Amicon filter for 1 hour","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2jh78","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"684fv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"10055","amount":"2","unit":"2","label":"","guid":"8A325CFEFB2140F6B508DFA083A356EC"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19838","duration":"3600","label":"","guid":"E39EFCBBA46045A8904EEB92A42806F2"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cjok","text":"Centrifuge filters at 1,000 g for 10 min (or until all BSA filters through) .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5bin8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19839","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"86F09A29175F4DEEA63625F119D9CEDA"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"as80l","text":"Wash filters by centrifuging filters with 2 ml 1x PBS at 1,000g for 10 min (or until all PBS is filtered through).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bvrb9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"421nq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"10056","amount":"2","unit":"2","label":"","guid":"96E1C6E67FED4715938AF46353BB68A2"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19840","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"BF0F30935E7E46D6B6DEDF8B5EB86939"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q6u6","text":"Concentrate samples with Amicon filters (to ~5ml for CsCl purification).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7g7te","text":"Store at 4\u00b0C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h93o","text":"DNA elutes in 100 \u00b5l","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C11CEBFB7B334605902859A9A481A9A4","id":668203,"previous_id":668212,"previous_guid":"B60C1B557DD1479FBBF457C9E81CCC98","section":"Day 4- DNA extraction"}
{"blocks":[{"key":"v5n0","text":"Put some DNA into a new tube for a working sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"331sa","text":"Check microbial contamination with qPCR 16S analyses (~3 \u00b5l).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4t7lt","text":"Quantify DNA with PicoGreen or Qubit (~2 \u00b5l).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ektdb","text":"NanoDrop for DNA purity (~2 \u00b5l).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgads","text":"You need 50 \u00b5l for shearing if you're using Swift kit (for ssDNA viruses; otherwise Nextera XT for dsDNA viruses).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0ele","text":"If you need to resize the DNA you can use AMPure beads (same ones that are used in the Swift kit) or a Pippin prep.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CA00EAC80DCF43B5AFB08D306312B99D","id":668209,"previous_id":668208,"previous_guid":"61AB6C52432A4B078A9CC71459B57155","section":"Day 5"}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3a93f","text":"Shake manually for 30 s at 4\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6j8de","text":"Shake manually for 30 s at 4\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
